current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To modify the prohibition on recognition by United States
		  courts of certain rights relating to certain marks, trade names, or commercial
		  names.

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the following
			 bill; which was read twice and referred to the

short-title.#text:
No Stolen Trademarks Honored in
			 America Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 211 of the Department of Commerce and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 1999
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Department of Commerce and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 1999/s:211

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 101(b) of division A of Public Law 105–277

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Department of Commerce and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 1999/s:211/ss:a/p:2

quote.#text:
that was used in connection with a business or assets
			 that were confiscated unless the original owner of the mark, trade name, or
			 commercial name, or the bonafide successor-in-interest has expressly
			 consented

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Department of Commerce and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 1999/s:211/ss:b

quote.#text: by a designated national or its successor-in-interest

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Department of Commerce and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 1999/s:211/ss:d
Department of Commerce and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 1999/s:211/ss:e
Department of Commerce and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 1999/s:211/ss:c
Department of Commerce and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 1999/s:211/ss:a/p:2

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: of this section shall apply only if the person or entity asserting the rights knew or had reason to know at the time when the person or entity acquired the rights asserted that the mark, trade name, or commercial name was the same as or substantially similar to a mark, trade name, or commercial name that was used in connection with a business or assets that were confiscated.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Department of Commerce and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 1999/s:211/ss:b
Department of Commerce and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 1999/s:211/ss:e

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 S647 IS: No Stolen Trademarks Honored in America Act
